intro: Canarium madagascariense subsp. bullatum, commonly known as the Madagascar nut tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by oval, woody fruits containing a single seed. It is valued for its hard, durable wood and is also used in traditional medicine. The subspecies bullatum is distinguished by its unique leaf morphology and growth habits compared to other Canarium species.
